thread.title: HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 24, 2015
thread.title_full: HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 24, 2015

title: HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 24, 2015
text:
HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 24, 2015 UPDATED 10:13 PM HST Oct 24, 2015 Scores: Da Blitz (Sat, Oct 24, 2015) 1 of 5 Previous Next 
Rain or shine, it's time for "Da Blitz" where we give you a weekly rundown on the high school football games you couldnâ€™t go to. Related 
Click here to get last night's scores. 
On Saturday, two games on the Big Island were scheduled but only one of them had the teams actually play. 
Ka'u vs. Pahoa ruled a draw after no officials showed up, an unfortunate way to end the season for both teams. 
But it was an exciting night for the Vikings who became this year's BIIF D-1 champs in their 41-20 win against Kealakehe. 
And on Kauai, the Kapa'a Warriors remain undefeated in 2015 with their 36-0 win against the Menehunes. They've now outscored their last six opponents 226-zero. 
It's a number that ties KIF single-season points scored record with the 1996 Waimea team. It's also a number that breaks the record for allowed KIF points with zero. Waimea set the last one in 1981. 
On the Valley Isle, Maui High takes down Kamehameha at 35-19. Warriors are done for the season at 3-6. Sabers get Baldwin next in the MIL D-1 championship game. 
Last week, the top two teams in the ILH battled it out. Saint Louis rallied from a 14-9 halftime deficit to defeat the previously undefeated Punahou at 30-14. 
Tonight, the Crusaders beat Punahou AGAIN and claim their first ILH title since 2010. Final score: 27-23. 
First round of the state tournament starts November 6th.
